page.title: 03Ecology-Witton & Ridlington
page.content: Land in N.E. has had hedges removed:very windswept in winter, but new planting of copses has taken place N. of Rookery Farm.Some trees,mainly oaks & mountain ash,now planted on roadside verges on main roads. {Footpaths}Mostly signposted but show little signs of use:were originally used by farmworkers to get to work etc.Fewer farm workers,bigger farms,mean use of cars. {Climate}Long cold springs dominated by N.E. winds the norm;even hot summer days are cooler thwn a few miles inland.1985 was a hard winter & wet summer.Changing tide often shifts weather pattern. {Pollution}Foul water drainage is mainly by septic tank;due to height of water table this causes problems with frequent emptying essential.
